First and foremost, the annexation of Crimea was not a democratic process. The referendum held on March 16, 2014, in which the people of Crimea supposedly voted to join Russia, was widely condemned by the international community as being illegitimate and lacking in transparency. The presence of armed soldiers and the perceived threat of violence created an atmosphere of intimidation, which undermined the legitimacy of the vote.
